alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hamilton County through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chattanooga, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Signal Mountain, Rossville, Walden, Ridgeside, Harrison, Red Bank, Collegedale, East Brainerd and East Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
